text:
Mr* Keith Engar
-2-
November 17, 1959
The point is that the Detroit meeting did
not structure things forever; the basic decision
was that HA^B would not at this time respond to
the Ford overtures to participate in its grand plan
in order to be beneficiaries of Ford* s largesse.
Certainly, no one wants to fight with Jack
and I agree that there are many areas and opportunities
for cooperation.
Again, thanks for all your good help, guy. In
the past year.
Cordially,
William G. Harley
WGH:cp
